Pre-Game Insights: Ben Stokes is set to return to the playing XI for England's upcoming World Cup 2023 fixture against South Africa in Mumbai.
Stokes missed England's first three matches in the tournament due to a hip injury.
England faced a worrying performance with both bat and ball in their previous match against Afghanistan.
It was widely believed that Ben Stokes and Harry Brook would not be part of the same XI, but England's batting struggles make the prospect of playing both more appealing.
Livingstone's contributions with the ball have been instrumental in giving captain Jos Buttler flexibility.
David Willey could replace either Woakes or Curran without compromising batting depth.
By replacing Curran with Stokes, England can alleviate concerns about their tail-end batting order.
